subject: Management
title: Repairing After Conflict
description: A short lesson to help you apply Repairing After Conflict.

hook.text: Two colleagues had a brutal argument on Tuesday. By Thursday, they pretended it never happened.

buildup.text: Unrepaired conflict leaves invisible scar tissue. The relationship looks fine but trust is damaged.

discovery.text: Repair means acknowledging what happened, owning your part, and explicitly resetting the relationship.

twist.text: Pretending nothing happened isn't moving on. It's suppressing. The tension leaks into every future interaction.

climax.text: Say: that was rough. I'm sorry for my part. How do we move forward? Simple, but powerful.

punchline.text: After the conflict, repair the bridge. Don't just cross it and forget.

quiz.question: Why is repair important after a conflict?
options: Unaddressed damage erodes trust and leaks into future interactions
Conflicts resolve themselves naturally without any follow-up
Repair makes the conflict seem more significant than it was
